snippet: Payments went to families that mistakenly claimed the tax credit or claimed the wrong amount, as well as to taxpayers who committed fraud.
abstract: Audit by J Russell George, Treasury inspector general for tax administration, reveals that the Internal Revenue Service paid at least $6 billion in child tax credits in 2013 to people ineligible to receive them.
lead_paragraph: Payments went to families that mistakenly claimed the tax credit or claimed the wrong amount, as well as to taxpayers who committed fraud.

headline.main: Billions in Child Tax Credits Were Invalid, U.S. Audit Finds
headline.print_headline: Billions in Child Tax Credits Were Invalid, U.S. Audit Finds
